subject: Leadership
title: Strategy Execution Gap
description: A 60-second lesson on Strategy Execution Gap.

hook.text: 67% of well-crafted strategies fail due to poor execution. The plan was brilliant. The follow-through wasn't.

buildup.text: The execution gap is the space between strategy's intent and results. It's where most organizational value is lost.

discovery.text: Common killers: unclear priorities, poor communication, misaligned incentives, and no accountability for milestones.

twist.text: Leaders blame the strategy when execution fails. But a mediocre strategy well-executed beats a great one poorly run.

climax.text: Close the gap with clear owners, regular check-ins, visible progress tracking, and the courage to reallocate when stuck.

punchline.text: Ideas are cheap. Execution is everything.

quiz.question: What is the strategy execution gap?
options: The time between planning and launching
The space between intent and results
